dialogue.text: Hello there, can I help you?
This is the town of Lumbridge my friend.
Aye, not too bad thank you. Lovely weather in Gielinor this fine day.
Yes weather, you know.
The state or condition of the atmosphere at a time and place, with respect to variables such as temperature, moisture, wind velocity, and barometric pressure.
Not just a pretty face eh? Ha ha ha.
What kind of quest are you looking for?
Hmm.. dangerous you say? What sort of creatures are you looking to fight?
You are a brave soul indeed.
Now that you mention it, I heard a rumour about a fortune-teller in Varrock who is rambling about some kind of greater evil.. sounds demon-like if you ask me.
Perhaps you could check it out if you are as brave as you say?
Well done! However I'm sure if you search around the world you will find more challenging foes to slay.
Ha ha. I personally don't believe in such things. However, there is a man in Draynor Village who has been scaring the village folk with stories of vampyres.
He's named Morgan and can be found in one of the village houses. Perhaps you could see what the matter is?
Yeah, yeah of course you did. Everyone knows vampyres are not real....
You're not fooling anyone you know.
Small? Small isn't really that dangerous though is it?
Yes ok, point taken. Speaking of small monsters, I hear old Wizard Mizgog in the wizards' tower has just had all his beads taken by a gang of mischievous imps.
Sounds like it could be a quest for you?
Imps will be imps!
I can tell you about plenty of small easy tasks.
The Lumbridge cook has been having problems, the Duke is confused over some strange talisman and on top of all that, poor lad Romeo in Varrock has girlfriend problems.
It's funny really, the cook would forget his head if it wasn't screwed on. This time he forgot to get ingredients for the Duke's birthday cake.
Perhaps you could help him? You will probably find him in the Lumbridge Castle kitchen.
Oh yes, so you have. I am sure the Duke will be pleased.
Well the Duke of Lumbridge has found a strange talisman that no one seems to understand. Perhaps you could help him? You can probably find him upstairs in Lumbridge Castle.
Ah excellent. Thank you very much adventurer.
Romeo in Varrock needs help with finding his beloved Juliet, you may be able to help him out.
Unless of course you manage to find Juliet first in which case she has probably lost Romeo.
Yes you can't miss him, he's wandering aimlessly in the square.
Really?
...How?
Well.. ok.. well done... I think...
Skills play a big part when you want to progress in knowledge throughout Gielinor. I know of a few skill- related quests that can get you started.
You may be able to help out Fred the farmer who is in need of someones crafting expertise.
Or, there's always Doric the dwarf who needs an errand running for him?
You can find Fred next to the field of sheep in Lumbridge. Perhaps you should go and speak with him.
Lumbridge chickens do make good target practice.
You will have to wait until he isn't looking.
Doric the dwarf is located north of Falador. He might be able to help you with smithing. You should speak to him. He may let you use his anvils.
Oh good, Thank you [player name]!
Of course I do. Gielinor is a huge place you know, now let me think...
Hetty the witch in Rimmington might be able to offer help in the ways of magical abilities..
Also, pirates are currently docked in Port Sarim, Where pirates are, treasure is never far away...
Or you could go help out Ernest who got lost in Draynor Manor, spooky place that.

Hetty the witch can be found in Rimmington, south of Falador. She's currently working on some new potions. Perhaps you could give her a hand? She might be able to offer help with your magical abilities.
Did she really?
Right.....
RedBeard Frank in Port Sarim's bar, the Rusty Anchor, might be able to tell you about the rumored treasure that is buried somewhere in Gielinor.
Yarr indeed my friend. A most excellent find.
Yarrr!
Right, that's enough of that!
The best place to start would be at the gate to Draynor Manor. There you will find Veronica who will be able to tell you more.
I suggest you tread carefully in that place; it's haunted.
A chicken!?
Very true, poor guy.
Yes, it does look like you need a hairdresser.
No problem. The hairdresser in Falador will probably be able to sort you out.
The Lumbridge general store sells useful maps if you don't know the way.
I assume the sky is up..
Yeah, unfortunately I don't seem to be able to look up.
It's not a stick! I'll have you know it's a very powerful staff!
Um..It's a bit low on power at the moment..
...Ok it's a stick.. But only while I save up for a staff. Zaff in Varrock square sells them in his shop.
Are you asking for free stuff?
No I do not have anything I can give you. If I did have anything of value I wouldn't want to give it away.
No it's not!
Fool! Leave me alone!
I heard the wall collapsed or something. I don't know why. Perhaps you could get to the bottom of this mystery!
RedBeard Frank in Port Sarim's bar, the Rusty Anchor, might be able to tell you about the rumoured treasure that is buried somewhere in Gielinor.
Oh good, Thank you ASuperDood!
